curated_text: Symbol: APD. Year: 2024. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense, Air Products, the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, Air Products Brasil Ltda, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, Amines, the Florida Department of Environmental Protection, the United States Environmental Protection Agency, FDEP, USEPA, the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control, SCDHEC, the Record of Decision, PUI, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality, RCRA, treasury, Pension, Total Balance, EPS, Diluted, Share Data, Air Products', Lu’An Clean Energy Company, Uzbekistan Asset Purchase, the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan, UNG, the NEOM Green Hydrogen Project, Variable Interest Entities, • Americas, • Corporate, Corporate, Business Segment Americas Asia Europe, India Corporate, Total Three Months Ended, 349.2 Equity, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Liquidity and Capital Resources 46, Critical Accounting Policies, This Management’s Discussion and Analysis, the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act, SEC, Supplemental Information, Air Products Founded, Air Products and Chemicals, Inc., Business Segment Information, JIGPC, • Diluted EPS, Non-GAAP Measures Adjusted EBITDA, Total Consolidated Sales Change, Research and Development Expense Research, Green Finance Framework, Non-Operating Income (Expense, % Total Americas Sales Change, Total Europe Sales Change, the U.S. Dollar, Euro, LNG, Millions of U.S. Dollars, Income/Expense, Air Products Diluted EPS Q1, 42 Table of Contents, Americas Three Months Ended, CAPITAL EXPENDITURES Capital, NEOM Green Hydrogen Company, NGHC, the U.S., Capital Expenditures, World Energy, Credit Agreement, NEOM Green Hydrogen Project Financing, The Board of Directors, the Board of Directors, Table of Contents Company Contributions Management, CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES, Management’s Discussion and Analysis, Foreign Currency Exchange. Context excerpt: competition, environmental, intellectual property, regulatory, product liability, and insurance matters. We do not currently believe there are any legal proceedings for which it is reasonably possible, individually or in the aggregate, to have a material impact on our financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows. In September 2010, the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense ("CADE") issued a decision against our Brazilian subsidiary, Air Products Brasil Ltda., and several other Brazilian industrial gas companies for alleged anticompetitive activities. CADE imposed a civil fine of R$ 179.2 million (approximately $ 37 at 31 December 2023) on Air Products Brasil Ltda. This fine was based on a recommendation by a unit of the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, following an investigation beginning in 2003, which alleged violation of competition laws with respect to the sale of industrial and medical gases. The fines are based on a percentage of our total revenue in Br
